text: I've collapse in the garden and medalta
found me in the garden and I was rushed
into intensive care over there for 11
days in an induced coma and then
attacked all my internal organs so I
lost four-fifths of my bowel wall then
everybody started wearing blue overalls
including porters and anybody else that
came near me you can see people sort of
looking and almost covering the mouths
to prevent them breathing in the germs
because they don't know what I've got
you got to really work your way through
it because it can make you feel very
alienated very isolated especially when
you in a room like this like I've been
for a long time now one room on your own
because it's antibiotic resistant and
because I'm pretty weak from all the
stuff that's gone on over the last five
years I ended up in intensive care
Andrew at the point of my two children
having to make a decision whether to
turn off the life support or not and
because they were indecisive my surgeon
said well let's just give it another two
or three days and see what happens and I
did come round gradually I think about
it a lot and I try and get I'm trying to
get my house in order if you like so if
the the worst thing happens then you
know I'm not leaving a mess because I'm
quite aware that it could the worst
thing could happen and it's just gotta
be done it's not beating me ain't
beating me at the last hurdle
you
